sense.name: occupy or expand the space all around something or someone
sense.commentary: Note: NP1 SURROUND ONESELF PP doesn't necessary have to mean physical presence Note: No sense of confinement or imprisonment around someone.
sense.examples: Snow-capped mountains surround the city. Gwen sat at her desk, surrounded by books and papers. The forest surrounds my property. I am surrounded by beauty! She said that she wanted to die surrounded by the people she loves. Cate surrounds herself with good friends to help her feel better.

sense.name: confine on all sides to bar escape or outside communication
sense.examples: Mystery still surrounds the exact circumstances of Stalin's death. Armed police surrounded a house which they thought contained an escaped prisoner. Police surrounded a bus full of passengers seized by armed hijackers along a highway.
